definition: assistance/a helping hand/to lend a hand
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Humble thyself to God, and wait for his hands.
sentences.chinese: 你在天主面前要自謙，等候他的援手。

sentences.english: But while such support as Wang Zhi’s is vital, it is a drop in the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 王志們的援手固然重要，但這僅是杯水車薪。

sentences.english: He knows that you can't do it alone-He wants to assist.
sentences.chinese: 主知道，你不能獨自做到，主想施出援手。

sentences.english: Feather immediately after the crash of God to humanity came to the rescue.
sentences.chinese: 羽神在空難發生後立即向人類伸出了援手。

sentences.english: That was the case of last week's rescue by four countries of the Benelux banks Dexia and Fortis.
sentences.chinese: 上個星期，四個國家向荷盧銀行伸出了援手。

sentences.english: People in need could always count on him for a hand-out.
sentences.chinese: 他還常常伸出援手助人之需。

sentences.english: Speak with Ogtinc to lend aid to their plight.
sentences.chinese: 跟奧汀克談一談並對他們的困境伸出援手。

sentences.english: The holidays are a great time to reach out to other people in need.
sentences.chinese: 節假日是向其他需要幫助的人伸出援手的好機會。

sentences.english: But Wu did nothing in order to save his own strength.
sentences.chinese: 但吳爲保存實力，坐視張之垮臺而不加援手。

sentences.english: The United States Government continues to stand by Malawians in their time of need.
sentences.chinese: 美國政府會繼續在馬拉維人民有需要的時候伸出援手。

sentences.english: A friend is the first person who comes in when the whole world has gone out.
sentences.chinese: 朋友是在衆叛親離時，第一個伸出援手的人。

sentences.english: Some people find it difficult to other people.
sentences.chinese: 有些人覺得哀告援手很貧窶。

sentences.english: There are old or new friends who could assist us.
sentences.chinese: 會有朋友適時伸出援手的，不論是新朋或舊識。

sentences.english: The size of Vincent's tumor inspired Luc to help.
sentences.chinese: 文森偌大的腫瘤促使連加恩伸出援手。

sentences.english: I gave him my phone number and promised to help.
sentences.chinese: 我給了他我的電話號碼，並答應伸出援手。

sentences.english: Belnap. 'I gave him my phone number and promised to help.
sentences.chinese: 我給了他我的電話號碼，並答應伸出援手。

definition: to meet with misfortune/to fall into dire straits
to help one another/to come to sb's help
a benefactor/a person who has significantly helped sb else
to contribute generously (idiom); help sb generously with money/to give generously to charity
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)
to uphold justice/to be loyal (to one's friends)/to stick by
lit. the exertion of lifting one's hand (idiom)/fig. a very slight effort
